Question: Implementing such an iterator?: :I have a list (an ArrayList, infact) of type HColumn<ColName, ColValue>. Now I want to implement an iterator() that iterates over this collection such that on iteration it gives out the corresponding ColValue from each HColumn.This object HColumn<ColName, ColValue> is defined in an external library used by my java application.How can I do that, if possible ?Currently, to create such an iterable, I had been creating a new list altogether containing corresponding ColValues which I guess is not good thing, in terms of performance & efficiency.
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer:
response:
Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
Question: Implementing such an iterator?: :I have a list (an ArrayList, infact) of type HColumn<ColName, ColValue>. Now I want to implement an iterator() that iterates over this collection such that on iteration it gives out the corresponding ColValue from each HColumn.This object HColumn<ColName, ColValue> is defined in an external library used by my java application.How can I do that, if possible ?Currently, to create such an iterable, I had been creating a new list altogether containing corresponding ColValues which I guess is not good thing, in terms of performance & efficiency.
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer: <<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
```java
Iterator<HColumn<ColName, ColValue>> iterator = myArrayList.iterator();
while(iterator.hasNext()) {
    HColumn<ColName, ColValue> hColumn = iterator.next();
    ColValue value = hColumn.getColValue();
    // do something with value
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we are using the iterator.next() method to get the next HColumn object from the iterator. Then we are using the getColValue() method of HColumn to get the ColValue from the HColumn object.

Please note that the getColValue() method is a method of HColumn class and it should be implemented by the developer of the HColumn class.

This code will iterate over the ArrayList and for each HColumn object, it will get the ColValue and do something with it. The ArrayList is not modified in this process.

This approach is efficient because it does not create a new list of ColValues. It directly accesses the ColValue from each HColumn object in the ArrayList.

So, this approach is good in terms of performance and efficiency.
